intro: Colpodium leianthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved colpodium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. Its leaves are elongated and have a finely divided appearance, contributing to its ornamental value. Colpodium leianthum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
